column5: DETROIT/TOKYO The safety recall in parts of the United States of millions of vehicles with potentially defective air bags made by Japan's Takata Corp  may expand to include General Motors Co   according to documents filed this week with U.S. regulators.

column4: Takata regional U.S. air bag recalls may include GM vehicles
column5: DETROIT/TOKYO  Sept 26 The safety recall in parts of the United States of millions of vehicles with potentially defective air bags made by Japan's Takata Corp  may expand to include General Motors Co  according to documents filed this week with U.S. regulators.

column4: GM's Opel says compact cars need checks for faulty steering
column5: FRANKFURT General Motor's  Opel business said on Friday that 8 000 of its Adam and Corsa compact cars delivered to customers in Europe since May 2014 need to be checked for faulty steering parts.

column4: GM and Isuzu to jointly develop mid-size pick-up truck
column5: TOKYO/DETROIT General Motors  and Japanese truck maker Isuzu Motors  have agreed to jointly develop a mid-size pick-up truck for sale in major markets around the world excluding North America  the two companies said on Friday.

column4: Isuzu says agreed with GM to jointly develop midsize pickup truck
column5: TOKYO  Sept 26 Japan's Isuzu Motors Ltd  said on Friday that it has agreed with General Motors Co  to jointly develop a midsize pickup truck for sale in several markets around the world  excluding the United States and Canada.

column4: Isuzu  GM to develop pickup truck for emerging markets - Nikkei
column5: TOKYO  Sept 26 Japan's Isuzu Motors Ltd  has agreed with General Motors Co to jointly develop a pickup truck for emerging markets  the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.

column4: Goldman tightens conflict-of-interest rules as scrutiny mounts
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has tightened rules on investments its bankers can make in individual stocks and bonds  a company spokesman said on Friday  as a U.S. Senator called for hearings into the Wall Street bank's conflict-of-interest policies.

column5: NEW YORK/WASHINGTON An influential U.S. senator wants to hold hearings into "disturbing" issues raised by secretly taped conversations between Federal Reserve supervisors and officials at Goldman Sachs Group Inc   a bank the Fed was tasked with policing.

column4: FAA hopes to restore air traffic in Chicago area in coming days
column5: WASHINGTON The fire set by an employee of Harris Corp at a Chicago-area air traffic control center on Friday may have caused significant damage  but the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) hopes to restore air traffic to relatively normal levels over the next few days  U.S. government officials said.

column4: U.S. judge scrutinizes HP shareholder deal in Autonomy case
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge on Friday sharply questioned provisions of a shareholder settlement that would release Hewlett-Packard Co  executives from liability over the computing company's botched acquisition of Autonomy Plc.

column4: Lloyds Bank sale of TSB stake shows demand for UK banks
column5: LONDON Lloyds Banking Group  has sold a further 11.5 percent stake in TSB  in a 161 million pound ($262.5 million) share placing to investors that required no discount to the market price following strong demand.

column4: Exclusive: Lockheed to buy European satellite for South Korea in F-35 deal
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  said it will buy a European-built military communications satellite for South Korea as part of a $7 billion deal to supply Seoul with 40 F-35 fighter jets  in what industry observers call among the most unusual "offset" agreements ever to accompany a major arms sale.

column4: New U.S. tax rules may lead Medtronic to redo inversion deal
column5: NEW YORK U.S. medical device maker Medtronic Inc  is likely to try to renegotiate the structure and terms of its $42.9 billion deal to buy Ireland's Covidien Plc  in response to new U.S. tax rules  according to people familiar with the situation.

column4: U.S. says unapproved genetically modified wheat found in Montana
column5: Monsanto Co's experimental genetically engineered wheat  never approved for sale  has been found growing in a second U.S. state  and regulators said on Friday they could not explain how the plants escaped field trials that ended almost a decade ago.

column4: Unapproved GMO wheat find should not hurt U.S. exports: trade group
column5: U.S. wheat exports should not be hurt by the second discovery of experimental Monsanto Co. genetically modified wheat growing in a U.S. state where it was not approved  industry leaders said on Friday  because the wheat is not believed to be in commercial channels.

column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 26 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Pfizer Inc.'s  (Pfizer's) ratings  including the 'A+' Issuer Default Rating (IDR). column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  September 26 (Fitch) The 25% initial public offering of Citizens  Financial lowers execution risks for Royal Bank of Scotland Group's  restructuring plan  Fitch Ratings says. But challenges remain for its  transformation into a simpler  smaller UK-focused bank. column5: Sept 26 Universal Health Services Inc  said it bought British mental health facilities operator Cygnet Health Care Ltd in a deal valued at about $335 million  to enter the UK market.

column5: Hedge fund ValueAct Capital said on Thursday it would return to the board of directors of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  which is pursuing a hostile takeover offer for Allergan Inc  and that it planned to increase its stake in the company.

column5: Sept 25 Hedge fund ValueAct Capital said on Thursday it would return to the board of directors of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  which is pursuing a hostile takeover offer for Allergan Inc  and that it planned to increase its stake in the company.

column4: U.S. consumer sentiment ends at 14-month high in September
column5: NEW YORK U.S. consumer sentiment finished September at its strongest in more than a year on growing optimism about the economy and more favorable outlook on future income  a survey released on Friday showed.

column4: Waste management firm Shanks cuts forecast  shares sink
column5: Waste management company Shanks Group Plc  warned that full-year results would be 15 percent below its estimates as trading conditions worsened at its solid-waste business in Belgium  the Netherlands and Luxembourg.

column5: Sept 25 Advisory firms Glass  Lewis & Co and Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) each have recommended that Darden Restaurants Inc investors back Starboard Value LP's 12-director slate  which would oust the embattled company's full board.
